intro: Erodium trichomanefolium subsp. cheilanthifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bedstraw, is a member of the Geraniaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, pink or red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its delicate structure and seasonal blooming make it a notable species in ecological and botanical studies.
